lexUnit.name: straddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be on both sides of.

sentence.text: Martin rose and straddled Richard 's chest .
She mounted the bed , and straddled him : her hot arse over his belly ; her face towards the foot of the bed .
The Mercedes had straddled the road , hemming him in , its two occupants now standing beside it , AK47 rifles in their gloved hands .
It was discovered at the earlier date that the remains of an impressive Roman villa straddled the course boundary .
She straddled the wall , her basket placed carefully on the big stone next to her , then hauled the little girls up and over , one after the other .
He straddled the bike and blipped the throttle .
One rectangular building straddled the compound fence with an annexe attached on the inside from which there did not appear to be access to the compound .
Now I straddled this heavy machine and revved with jerked gauntlet .
Denis had turned the other chair round and now straddled it , his arms crossed and resting along its back , the gun on the tea-chest within easy reach .
A fly straddles another fly on the faded denim stretched over the knee .
The Mount Nimba range , which straddles Guinea , Liberia and Côte d'Ivoire , comprises some of Africa 's richest rainforest .
The author is 28 , film options have already been sold , Penguin is pushing it , and all in all it 's terrific , a sophisticated literary novel that could straddle the markets .
Research on hazards is multidisciplinary and straddles the social , environmental and mathematical sciences .
As a general argument it straddles the two others , being more limited than either but broader than each .
The opening ` Angel 's Delight " straddles the two extremes , swinging from deceptive sweetness to quivering vitriol and dementia .
Borrowing a line of dialogue from his new movie , The Mambo Kings , he proclaims , ` I love this country ! " as a buxom brunette in a skimpy white dress straddles his prone body .
